question: In the reaction between moist <katex>$SO_{2}$</katex> and acidified permanganate solution:
choices: <katex>$SO_{2}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$SO_{4}^{2-}$</katex> and <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$Mn^{2+}$</katex>
<katex>$SO_{2}$</katex> is reduced to S and <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$MnO_{4}$</katex>
<katex>$SO_{2}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$SO_{3}^{2-}$</katex> and <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$MnO_{2}$</katex>
<katex>$SO_{2}$</katex> is reduced to <katex>$H_{2}S$</katex> and <katex>$MnO_{4}^{-}$</katex> is oxidised to <katex>$MnO_{4}$</katex>
explanation: Acidified potassium permanganate is a strong oxidizing agent. It oxidizes sulphur dioxide (<katex>$SO_2$</katex>) to sulphate ion (<katex>$SO_4^{2-}$</katex>) and is itself reduced from permanganate (<katex>$MnO_4^-$</katex>) to manganous ion (<katex>$Mn^{2+}$</katex>).
